wikipedia_page.main: William Gregg VC DCM MM (27 January 1890 – 10 August 1969) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *William Gregg (VC) (1890–1969), British First World War Victoria Cross recipient
*William Gregg (industrialist) (1800–1867), founder of the pioneer Graniteville, South Carolina textile mill
*William Gregg (tennis), Australian tennis player in 1907 Australasian Championships
*William Gregg (New Zealand), founder of the New Zealand company Gregg's
*William Gregg (clerk and spy) (died 1708), Scottish clerk and spy
*William Gregg (theologian) (1817–1909), Canadian theologian and clergyman; Professor of Apologetics
